meanings.sent1: She climbed the echelle to reach the attic.
meanings.sent2: The fireman quickly ascended the echelle to rescue the cat.
meanings.sent3: The echelle in the library was so tall, it seemed to touch the sky.
meanings.sent4: In her dream, the echelle symbolized her journey to success.
meanings.sent5: The echelle creaked under the weight of the heavy books.

meanings.sent1: The echelle of colors on the wall chart helped the students learn.
meanings.sent2: The echelle of sizes ranged from small to large.
meanings.sent3: The echelle of difficulty levels in the game made it challenging.
meanings.sent4: His emotions followed an echelle from joy to sadness.
meanings.sent5: The echelle of prices at the store made her budgeting easier.

meanings.definition: A musical scale or ladder of notes
meanings.sent1: The musician practiced the echelle on the piano.
meanings.sent2: The echelle of notes in the song created a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent3: The echelle of sounds from the orchestra filled the concert hall.
meanings.sent4: Her voice followed an echelle of pitches that mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The echelle of harmonies in the choir performance was breathtaking.
